CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 23, 1969, pg. 17, reads: "Mr. and Mrs. Frank T. Harp, Jr. ...Harris Photo." Accompanying article reads: "Miss Yates Bride of F. T. Harp Jr.  One of summer's prettiest brides was Mary Elizabeth Yates, who repeated marriage vows with Frank T. Harp Jr., August 2, at the home of the bride's parents.  Reverend Brown performed the ceremony.  The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward B. Yates.  The groom is the son of Frank T. Harp St. and Mrs. Ida Page Harp, Northside.  Best man for his brother was Harry J. Harp.  The bride's sister was maid of honor.  Prettily gowned, she carried blue and white carnations.  Flower girl was Linda Lowry.  Ring bearer was the bride's small brother Latin Yates.  The bride chose a short gown with long lace sleeves and a high neck, Victorian style.  She carried a handsome bouquet, and wore an orchid corsage.  Both the bride's mother and the groom's mother wore blue and white carnation corsages.  A charming reception followed the wedding.  The bride, a graduate of Westinghouse High School, is a secretary at the National Biscuit Company plant in East Liberty.  The groom, a graduated of Allegheny Vocational High School, is a veteran of the Vietnam war.  He is a member of Arter Murphy Post 703 - American Legion.  The young couple plan to make their home on the Northside."
TitMainTitle: Groom Frank T. Harp Jr. and bride Mary Elizabeth Yates Harp, posed in yard of Yates home
